message.content: Now I can see the key feedback from the code review. The main issue is a potential performance problem in the backend where the PUT endpoint returns all items for a feed, which could be slow for large feeds. Let me fix this by limiting the number of items returned in the response:

function.arguments:
{"command": "str_replace", "path": "/workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py", "old_str": "        # Return full feed data including items for frontend to update widget
        feed_data = feed.to_dict()
        # Include feed items in the response
        feed_data['items'] = [item.to_dict() for item in feed.items]", "new_str": "        # Return full feed data including items for frontend to update widget
        feed_data = feed.to_dict()
        # Include only recent feed items in the response (limit to 10)
        feed_data['items'] = [item.to_dict() for item in feed.items.order_by(FeedItem.published_time.desc()).limit(10)]", "security_risk": "LOW"}
function.name: str_replace_editor

args.old_str:
# Return full feed data including items for frontend to update widget
        feed_data = feed.to_dict()
        # Include feed items in the response
        feed_data['items'] = [item.to_dict() for item in feed.items]
args.new_str:
# Return full feed data including items for frontend to update widget
        feed_data = feed.to_dict()
        # Include only recent feed items in the response (limit to 10)
        feed_data['items'] = [item.to_dict() for item in feed.items.order_by(FeedItem.published_time.desc()).limit(10)]
args.thought: Now I can see the key feedback from the code review. The main issue is a potential performance problem in the backend where the PUT endpoint returns all items for a feed, which could be slow for large feeds. Let me fix this by limiting the number of items returned in the response:
